definition: (idiom) to rely on a single authority to determine what is correct/to regard a source (or entity or individual) as the ultimate authority
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel

sentences.english: In this aspect, the dissemination study present is all flowers blooms together, has not decided one.
sentences.chinese: 在这方面，传播学现在是百花齐放，没有定于一尊。

definition: dismiss the hundred schools, revere only the Confucians (slogan of the Former Han dynasty)
a hundred schools of thought contend (idiom); refers to the classical philosophic schools of the Warring States period 475-221 BC
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
to revere the past and neglect the present (idiom)
Former Han dynasty school of Confucian scholars

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 zhong1 xin1 zhu3 yi4

definition: centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
